thread.title: Trump Taunts Schwarzenegger About ‘Celebrity Apprentice’ Low Season Premiere Ratings
thread.title_full: Trump Taunts Schwarzenegger About ‘Celebrity Apprentice’ Low Season Premiere Ratings

author: Randy DeSoto
title: Trump Taunts Schwarzenegger About ‘Celebrity Apprentice’ Low Season Premiere Ratings
text:
Trump Breaks Precedent, Calls For Immediate Resignation Of US Ambassadors 
Entertainment Weekly reported on Tuesday, “Celebrity Apprentice ratings fall sharply without Trump.” 
“With Arnold Schwarzenegger taking over for President-elect Donald Trump in the boardroom, NBC’s two-hour premiere delivered 4.9 million viewers and a 1.3 rating among adults 18-49 on Monday night,” according to Entertainment Weekly. 
“That’s down a steep 44 percent in the ratings compared to the reality show’s previous opener back in 2015 (which was on a Sunday night vs. this season’s Monday debut). NBC points out, the show faced heavy competition for male viewers from ESPN’s Rose Bowl and Sugar Bowl coverage,” the news site added.   
The Rose Bowl was in fact a barn burner with the USC Trojans defeating the Penn State Nittany Lions (after multiple lead changes) in a closing seconds 52 to 49. The game ended about 9:30 p.m. Eastern, an hour-and-a-half into Schwarzenegger’s premiere for a large segment of the country. It was followed immediately by the Super Bowl, featuring Auburn against the Univ. of Oklahoma. 
Trump, who remains the executive producer of Celebrity Apprentice , did not seem to think the programming competition was the deciding factor. He tweeted on Friday: Wow, the ratings are in and Arnold Schwarzenegger got "swamped" (or destroyed) by comparison to the ratings machine, DJT. So much for…. 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 6, 2017 being a movie star-and that was season 1 compared to season 14. Now compare him to my season 1. But who cares, he supported Kasich & Hillary 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 6, 2017
